intro: Fumaria sepium subsp. rugosa, commonly known as the rough yellowcress, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The subspecies is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils such as along roadsides or in meadows. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
